Half-Life, what is it, is it a video game, could it be a tale that no other game could do without getting it wrong, yes... 
For me, Half-Life was the first ever game I bought an owned, I remember that day. August 2nd, 2007, my father got me my very own steam account, and this game, my first game, MY VERY OWN GAME! It was amazing to me, I remember fearing for my life, crying as the civil protection was "clearing" the apartments, or when I first encounter Alyx Vance, Barney, Doctor Kliner, and his pet head crab, Lamar. Or when I first saw the Air Boat, and realizing that something epic will come, and it did, yah, an air boat is cool, BUT WHAT ABOUT A UPGRADE THAT WOULD MAKE ME AND THE HUNTER CHOPER EQUALS, AND ABLE TO FIGHT IT ON! Later after that, I fought with the metallic flying beast, and we both knew only one of us would survive to tell the tale. I remember when I first met D0G, a robotic canine, well, similar, but more then just a yaye-high pet. Then I grew of anger as the combine destroyed everything that was of Black Mesa East. I had to go to Ravenholm, a place that even my most cherished companion, Alyx, feared and avoided to look towards that direction, I wondered why this was the case. But I had to put my friends fears of that pace aside, and march in, and continue my journey towards the end goal. As I slowly put my foot on the old, and ruined grass, I see death, despair, and danger. I feared Ravenholm a lot, I guess you could say, it was too much for me. Ever since, I never escaped Ravenholm...

But then, in the summer of 2012, I returned to Half-Life 2, played through it again, and looked towards that dreaded place as Alyx was explaining about it, before the combine attack. I knew I had to finish Half-Life! And so, I got a fucking huge 2 L bottle of Coca Cola, and journeyed through that place, I remember my hart beating as those Fast Zombies were clawing at me, and waiting for that small platform to carry me away from danger. Then me, and a creepy religious man with a double barrel shotgun walked through the graveyard, and at that last moment, he sacrificed himself for ME! I remember my shocked mind as he ran through fire, laughing and killing the zombies. I turned towards the exit, and ran without looking back. I remember seeing the sun again, and never felt the same ever again. I remember seeing the Jeep and was shocked, first an Air boat, now a Jeep with, a, umm, laser gun, oohhh boy, the looks were deceiving, I then killed my first gunship, and crossed the large, shaking bridge, and avoiding the train as it did its routine...

Oh yah, then the sand traps, I ran right through that, then the prison, boy, I remember laughing as I saw the antlions take down combine and/or the turrets, and seeing how loyal they were to me, this was just the beginning, then me and Alyx teleport in the FUTURE, well more like a week, but then all of humanity decided to start an uprising due to the signal after teleporting from the citadel. Then I fought lots of striders, soldiers, CP's, gunships, till I got to the citadel. That first moment where intense music started right as I exit a sewage pipe, to see the citadel slowly mining into the planet, I had to stop them, and so I did, with the help of the combine and their fucked up anti-weapon device, they modified my anti-gravity gun, to grab soldiers, and also, have an higher carnage. And I fought with Breen, destroyed the citadel, and saw the Gman again, this all felt amazing ,the carnage, the intense finally, and the perfect cliff hanger for the next 2 episodes, that I got later...
Super jeu. L'histoire est géniale. Les voix sont refaîtes en francais.  Bref Super jeu.

This is the best game I've played in my entire life

The game is literally 6 months younger than me (I was born in May of 2004, this released in November of 2004) 

I found the game thanks to a youtuber, PixelTwitch, he sadly no longer does youtube, but you can still watch his playthough of the series, if you so wish.

I definitely will be forcing my future children to play this when they're old enough to understand the story.

The only real con is just that the graphics are dated, and there's a huge lack of non-sexual retexture mods. That or I just don't know where to look lol.

The soundtrack is phenomenal, the gameplay is a nice mix of fast-paced action, and slow story building.

The achievements can be a bit annoying to get, but very worth the satisfaction when you do get them.

Recommend 9.9/10

This game is everything that the original game is not.  Indeed, Half-Life 2 is the franchise grown up, and proving that it still has legitimacy in todays gaming world.

The story of Half-Life 2 is a bit of a roller coaster in that there are great moments of narrative flow and others where you are left scratching your head a bit thinking "why did they put that in there?".  But saying that, there are plenty of ups to the few downs.  The story is overall strong and immersive with a few deviations that help create a vibrant lore.

The game mechanics are obviously much smoother, and well structured.  By todays standards, they stand up.  There are some nice features with the engine that work well.  The feel of the game when using certain weapons and the ability to manipulate some aspects of the environment help the gameplay support the story.  There are still a few things that don't seem right, such as no hands on steering wheels, being able to climb a ladder whilst simulatenously reloading or firing a heavy weapon, getting caught on obstacles, and the clumsy and altogether painful squads that do 2 things - 1) Die over and over, and 2) Get in your way when you need to do a run and gun (or often a grenade lob and duck).  The squad could definitely have used some more commands other than point and press C to have them run uselessly a couple feet before returning to interfere.

The weapons pretty much were a joy to use, especially the Pulse Rifle and the SMG.  No alien weapons to use in this game, other than the Antlion Pheropods, and this was the clumsiest weapon.  A few odd decisions were made with some of the weapons though, especially the .357 Magnum revolver.  Having a total ammo store of 18 rounds resulted in this being an often unused weapon.  Surely, Gordon could carry more than 18 bullets for this gun, considering the number he could carry for some of the others like the 9mm with a total ammo store of 168.  I'm sure it was for a balance purpose, but only being able to carry 18 rounds felt silly and frivolous.  The magnum went from being a mainstay weapon of the original series to a bit of a joke weapon in my mind.

Of the gameplay, I'm so happy that they decided to move away from the platform styled approach.  Moving across impossible terrain features and engineering in the original games made it feel like a caricature of a game.  Those titles didn't know if they were a shooter, narrative or platformer, often falling more towards the latter.  This game for the most part does away with that completely.  There are still a few gameplay components that aren't well thought out, mainly by being overly long and taking something novel and at first fun, and making it tedius - namely riding the airboat, and crossing the sand without touching it.  Both were fun at first, but quickly devolved into just hoping that it would soon be over, but nope - there was more and more of it.  Still, those didn't detract too much from the game as a whole.

The passage of time in the game, like in the first one though, still seems odd.  The immersion of that point is lost easily with the change from night to day as you are constantly on the move, never seeming to rest.... Jack Bauer, eat your heart out.

Overall, Half-Life 2 was and still is a great game, and my concerns with the game are more exagerated nitpicks than hangups.

4.5/5

Half-life... a true classic, a must play, an experience!
My dad recommended it to me a year ago right before the summer sale where I picked up the entire pack for only 10$ (what a bargain!) so you start with the classic one, the one that started it all for valve, then the award winning Half-Life 2 which contains amazing story elements gameplay and effect! Then episode 1 which continues the ending of 2 making it nearly as great as the second and then episode 2 which is just as great as the first 2 combined! Hell all them are great and I wish I could experience it again and again! If your out there, and thinking of getting this game. Well my friend grab a drink, your gaming mouse, and wallet because your about to experience one of valve's greatest games!

总算是通关了，久仰半条命的大名，以前玩盗版的时候玩过几个章节，当时玩的时候，我就惊讶了，这居然是2004年的游戏，各种场景布局，画面细节，物理效果放今天来看都是相当不错的，作为一款射击类游戏，其中还添加了不少的解迷元素，就更加能看出开发组的用心了，如今入了steam这个坑之后，趁着夏促买了一个，也算是对这个系列，对Valve表达的喜爱之情吧(然而G胖这王八蛋貌似不打算出第三部了)。还有，真搞不懂为什么你们都说玩这个特别晕，反正我是没啥感觉(手动滑稽)。

Valve действительно умеют делать игры с революционным значением. Каждая часть Half-Life была неким переворотом и в следствие этого всегда была на высоте. В игре присутствует невероятная атмосфера и геймплей. Серия игр Half-Life отличалась именно этим. Графика и геймплей этой игры настолько гармоничны, что эту игру и вправду можно назвать лучшим шутером. Моя оценка к игре: 9,5/10. В игре все абсолютно гармонично, но есть мелкие недочеты, однако особого влияния на игру не имеют. Спасибо Valve за такой прекрасный продукт, как Half-Life!

My first time playing half life ever and it's great. Even with its age, the graphics and sound are beautiful. The game has a great blend of action, horror, and drama with a good pace. There were even a few parts that really got my heart pumping. The only problem I have with the game is getting stuck on a piece of 2inch thick wood that I can't just step over and sometimes it is difficult to get off of the ladders. Some simple but annoying things with the character movements. I could only imagine what playing this game when it first came out would have been like. But for me playing it today, I still give it 8.5/10. I want to try it now with mods (:

I played it about two years ago I believe. I really enjoyed the game but something weird happened. I have never experienced motion sickness before until I played this game. Right before the helicopter part of the game and during, I started getting motion sickness while playing the game. On one hand it means the game visually is amazing!! But on the other hand for myself, I could not finish it because I would get so sick. It's an amazing game and I would totally recommend it for anyone as long as you dont get motion sickness that is.
